body.p: Customizing the PDF output requires knowledge of CSS, Paged Media, and DITA. The following list provides some resources to help you:

ul.li: CSS - You can find a good tutorial here: . Also, the specification is available on the W3C () or on the MDN () websites.

CSS Paged Media - This is a part of the CSS specification that shows how to organize your publication in pages, how to use headers/footers, page breaks, and other page-related issues. The specification is available here: . Also, there is a set of hands-on examples in the Oxygen PDF Chemistry user guide: .

DITA - You will need a basic understanding of DITA elements, attributes, and structure. A good resource is The DITA Style Guide - Best Practices for Authors by Tony Self. It is available at: www.ditastyle.com and: . You can find all the details for every DITA element on OASIS website: .
HTML5 - You will need a good knowledge of HTML5. You can find resources here:
Webinars - Some helpful webinars are available on our website: . They explain how to generate PDF from DITA documents using CSS, step-by-step.
